name: Hotel Duquesne Eiffel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As part of our honymoon in late September my wife and I stayed in the Exclusive Duquesne Eiffel for one night. We had no problems locating the hotel as its close to the Metro station and on a fairly busy road. Noise however is no problem at all, we had a superior room with views of the Eiffel tower facing the road and were not disturbed at all. The staff at the hotel are knowledgable and helpful and I would reccommend this hotel to anyone looking at staying in Paris for a few days. My only negative coment would be that the rooms may be a bit small, but thats not unusual for rooms in Paris hotels.
reviews.title: Great find in super location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here in July - it was one of the nominated hotels for a conference I attended nearby. Great choice! I had a back room which was nicely decorated with good furniture and in good condition.
reviews.title: Great staff, pleasant hotel
Great hotel (aka "Hotel Duquesne")
reviews.text: The staff were endlessly patient, charming and extremely helpful. I witnessed a couple of encounters with demanding guests which were handled with aplomb and courtesy [I would've been showing them the door after 10 minutes, but the lovely receptionist kept her cool].

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had moved to the Duquesne from a more expensive hotel in the Marais and thought the Duquesne was better value. Other reviews are right - the area is elegant with plenty of cafes, restaurants and food shops close by. It offered a calmer contrast to the Marais, but both areas had a lot to offer.
reviews.title: Fantastic view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel for four nights in September, 2007. Our room was adorable -- small (as most European hotel rooms are), and very tidy. We had hoped for a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower, and even though all rooms with this view had been booked solid for weeks, the staff managed to squeeze us in when someone else canceled. Our room had a spectacular view, encompassing the Tower as well as Basilique du Sacre Couer (and the Ecole Militaire, naturally, since the hotel is so close to this building).
reviews.title: Can't say enough good things about Duquesne Eiffel

likes.liked: — Location overall and close proximity(and view) to Eiffel Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful time we had¬! I took my husband he for a suprise birthday weekend. Paid extra for a superior room and am so glad i did. view was perfect, area was fab, lotss of places to eat although would recommend getting out for 7:30 ish to eat as we left it until about 8:45 pm one night and couldnt find and free tables, so busy!
reviews.title: Amazing time in paris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel, perfect get what you pay for, clean, tidy and perfect location.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Also went to Museum and Disneyland, was easy via metro and reasonable proce.
reviews.title: good money for cramped and mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Perfect would recommend for any one without a young family. Too small for youung family.
reviews.title: As good as predicted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a weekend in a superior room, though it was on 1st floor, so we could see the Eiffel tower if we crooked our heads to see it between the trees.
reviews.title: They had no room!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Little Hotel... Went on our honeymoon.... Highly recommeded.... Right by metro, cafes and food stores.... Would definately stay again.....Also what a view of the Eiffel Tower!
reviews.title: Great Hotel---- Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a short break to celebrate our 25th anniversary and what a great hotel. Staff were extremely helpful and all spoke great English, Little welcome pack with local restaurants and Parisian sites was very good.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Room was relatively small but clean and airy. Best of all we were lucky enough to get a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower - what a bonus!
reviews.title: Fantastic Parisian hotel...look no further.
Duquesne Eiffel Hotel
reviews.text: If your trip is, like ours, a celebration then I cannot recommend the Seine Dinner Cruise enough. We paid out (a lot!) for the Premier Service but it was a really wonderful evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Tips
reviews.title: Just Fantastic!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We made a decision in July to go to Paris in September. Hotels recommended by friends were booked, but the Dusquene Eiffel was available. The great Trip Advisor reviews clinched it. The only room type available online was the comfort double, but the attentive staff responded with the offer of an upgrade to a superior room. Based on reviews, I chanced requesting Room 55, and it was available for four of the five nights we wanted. The fifth night was in room 25.
reviews.title: Completely exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and the hotel were wonderful. All rooms ending in 5 are corner rooms with views of the Eiffel Tower through french doors. Room 55 at the top of the hotel has the best view and a two-sided balcony from which you also can see Sacre Coeur and Les Invalides. The star attraction, of course, is the Eiffel Tower. At night, it sparkles in your window on the hour with the lights installed for the Millennium celebration. Magical, and surely one of the best views in all of Paris. Room 56 next door is smaller but also has direct views of the Tower from the bed. It would be nice if the hotel would put flower boxes and a couple of small chairs and a little table on the balcony. That would make it perfection.
reviews.title: average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW! A terrific hotel. We selected this hotel through trip Adviser and everything was as expected. Excellent hotel staff (Estelle & Judi) helped us find restaurants and hooked us up with metro weekly passes. Location is spectacular. Owned and operated by French personnel, this hotel is a great value!
reviews.title: July Visit to Duquesne Eiffel Hotel
Sweet Little Place
reviews.text: Nice, comfortable, warm 3 star hotel near Ecole Militiare and Rue Cler. Easy to get to - just a block and a half from a metro stop. But far away enough from the busy streets to be relaxed and quiet. Older building with a small lobby with sofa's and a small bar. Old style spiraling staircase and very small elevator. Front desk staff speaks multiple languages and were fairly knowledgeable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms small, but not claustrophobic. Warm colors, my wife and I were in a room with yellows and blues; our sons with reds and yellows. Closets quite small. Bathrooms nice - modern fixtures and hair blower. Windows kept out the street noise and mattresses comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet in basement worth the price - 11 euro I think. Coffee, eggs, bread, cheese, yogurt, cereal, etc.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Neighborhood close to Eiffel Tower. Rue Cler blocks have fabulous shops - bread, cheese, and pastry shops plus several cafes. Larger corner cafes have the street scene. Nearby small restaurants - wonderful.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

likes.liked: — The central location and the view of the Eiffel Tower.
likes.disliked: — Walls are not well insulated for sound, but no big deal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I just returned from a trip to Paris where my two sisters and I spent three nights at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel. The hotel is located in a quiet residential area but is close enough to walk to all the attractions, great restaurants and shopping. While the room was a bit small according to American standards, it was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff could not have been more helpful. The desk clerks made reservations for dinner and had some good recommendations. They were most helpful in obtaining train schedules for the balance of our journey. The hotel is showing a few signs of age such as scuff marks on the walls in the hall, but our room was updated. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: My overall experience in Paris was terrific - surprisingly, the only rude people were the cab drivers (probably a universal thing) and if you at least made an attempt to speak French, even those with limited English were most helpful.
reviews.title: First visit to Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel - the rooms were spotless and the staff helpful and friendly. Although a little out of the centre we were able to walk to the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower and the Metro is only two blocks away. Would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable, after gaining entry..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was recently in Paris for a conference and stayed for five nights at this charming hotel not far from the Eiffel Tower and les Invalides. The service was extremely friendly and consistent. Breakfasts were solid and the location was good for some tourist things, although not fantastic for others (most nearby dining was tourist oriented and there wasn't much access to authentic local happenings). The only problem - and it was considerable - was my room key/door. After my first night, my key stopped working. The staff were most accommodating, although it became quite annoying to have to ask someone to be let into my room each and every time I needed to enter it. Also, I had some security concerns as a result of this as no one ever asked for ID before opening my door. Of course, this could be because they had excellent memories, but I'm skeptical. So, after one decent night, I had four questionable others. I'd recommend this to someone who wants to stay near the tower, but don't stay in room 11.
reviews.title: Very good hotel with a few minor hiccups

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at this hotel are lovely. They were extremely friendly and helpful. We had a few hiccups during our stay which they smoothed out with a smile as quickly as possible. (Some issues with the room key, and also our reservation was mistakenly taken down for one night rather than two.) They were also helpful with restaurant reservations, metro directions, etc.
reviews.title: Loved view & people at Duquesne Eiffel Hotel

likes.liked: — View from the room , people, close to metro station, facilities (AC and mini bar)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the hotel based on the reviews on this website. We were warmly greeted at the hotel and given Room 51, a "superior" room, as we had requested, with a view from the balcony of the Eiffel Tower.
reviews.title: Minor Grievances

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As stated by many, the European rooms are a bit smaller than standard U.S. rooms, and this one was no exception. The room was nicely appointed, clean and had a modern and roomy bath. The view from the balcony was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Although we were ready to collapse, we rallied and walked all the way around the Louvre complex , then returned along the Seine back to visit the Eiffel Tower. By then it was 9:30 and we were amazed that the sun still had not set!
reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you're picking this hotel, because you want to see the tower out your window, DON'T! We were so excited about staying at this hotel based on the reviews. We'd seen the candid visitor photos where you can see the eiffel tower from the window of your room. IF you booked a superior room. So, we made sure to book 2 superior rooms, so that my husband and I, as well as grandma and the kids could both have a spectacular view of the tower from our room. We booked months in advance. But apparently, booking early doesn't get you any consideration. Imagine our incredible disappointment when we arrived to find that the room for Grandma and the kids #35 did have a good view of the tower, but the room that they put me and my husband in , #54, did NOT have a view of the tower. When I went downstairs, to ask to be moved to the room that they'd advertised, the clerk slammed things around, and informend me that yes, the room WAS a superior room. I just had to GO OUT ON MY BALCONY, and look way around to the right, and then I could see it. First, if you're at all afraid of heights, there's no way you're going out on that balcony. Second, you can't stay out there, it's far to narrow. The hotel staff was COMLETELY unconcerned that the romantic evening they'd advertised was in fact a lie. In fact, there are only 3 rooms in the hotel with a view of the tower out your window as they advertise, but many more than that with NO view of the tower out your window that they classify as SUPERIOR. So, if you think that you're going to get one of the good ones for certain just because you book a superior room, DON'T COUNT ON IT! You're really paying for a CHANCE that you get a room with a real view of the tower. Also, if you do stay at this hotel, the breakfast room is like an oven. I'd eat somewhere else.
reviews.title: It was all a bunch of lies. Superior does NOT mean a guranteed view!

likes.disliked: — They weren't what they said they were, and staff was surly/unconcerned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel at least 5 times in the past 7-8 years and just enjoy staying there. The location is to my mind, perfect - the Rodin Museum, Ecole Militaire and of course the view of the Eiffel tower. The rooms are very well decorated, if a bit small, the bath tubs are deep and shower strong, and best of all there is air conditioning. What I also like is the location in the proximity of the Rue Cler Market, with all the lovely stalls with fruits, veggies, and meats and the restaurants many of which are patronised by French people. With the Metro stop nearby you can get to anywhere very quickly. There is a bus that you can get near the hotel that goes along Rue St. Dominique and gets you to other areas of Paris.
reviews.title: my favorite quartier and hotel
Great location
reviews.text: Quiet location but close to metro, Eiffel Tower (great view from my room on 5th floor), Les Invalides and the spectacular Rodin museum and gardens. Fair choice of restaurants, we loved Le Vauban (in Place Vauban) 36 euro for 3 courses, kir, wine and coffee.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel last night and it is in a very good area. So you don't need to worry to walk out at a late time. Nice restaurants in the area, we ate as "Pasco" and it was very nice french food. The Eiffel tower is only walking distance.
reviews.title: Good hotel in good area
Wow!!! Great Stay.
reviews.text: I had a superior room with bath tube and the bath was spotless. The room has to seperate beds and a flat tv at the wall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even if you don't have a view, the location of this hotel is perfect. A 10-minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, a 5-minute walk to Invalides, and a 5-minute walk to the subway stop. There are many restaurants and cafes nearby, with a wide range of prices and cuisine.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

likes.disliked: — That we couldn't stay longer (ONLY 9 days...lol!)...seriously, not one complaint!

reviews.title: Duquesne not as perfect as people say. Average hotel
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel was great. They were helpful with directions, offered to book tickets for us, and many other things (like giving us glasses with ice for the soft drinks we bought at the store!). They even had converters for us to borrow for the duration of our stay! Everyone we met was very friendly and tried to help make our stay pleasant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to book this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. A few days before we were due to arrive we received an e-mail from the hotel saying they had double booked and our booking would be moved to another hotel. Since the other hotel suggested was one we had looked at but decided against and since if we had booked the other hotel at the outset it would have been cheaper we contacted the Duquesne and they agreed to honour our booking.
reviews.title: Ok hotel but didn't live up to the reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was minute and dark as it looked onto an internal space (although this did mean it was quiet) and not quite as clean as I would have liked. That said the location was good and we had a lovely stay in Paris but I would hesitate to go back to the Duqesne.
reviews.title: what more could we ask for?

description: This cosy hotel offers numerous advantages such as its geographic location, appreciated as much for “leisure” vacations as it is for business meetings. Between “les Invalides” and the Eiffel Tower, the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel is located in one of Paris’ most pleasant boroughs on the famous left bank of the Seine. The team welcomes you with a smile 24/7, while taking all the necessary measures to ensure that your stay is a pleasant one.
